PipelineUCSC.py - utility functions for accessing UCSC data¶

Author:Andreas Heger
Release:$Id$
Date:April 02, 2014
Tags:Python

Purpose¶

This module provides methods for accessing ucsc data.

Usage¶

This module reads the [ucsc] section of a configuration file requiring the following variables to be set:

host
host to connect to
user
username to connect with
database
database to use

Documentation¶

Code¶

PipelineUCSC.getRepeatsFromUCSC(dbhandle, repclasses, outfile)¶

select repeats from UCSC and write to outfile in gff format.

If repclasses is None or an empty list, all repeats will be collected.

PipelineUCSC.importRefSeqFromUCSC(infile, outfile, remove_duplicates=True)¶

import gene set from UCSC database based on refseq mappings.

Outputs a gtf-formatted file a la ENSEMBL.

Depending on remove_duplicates, duplicate mappings are either removed or kept.

Matches to chr_random are ignored (as does ENSEMBL).

Note that this approach does not work as a gene set, as refseq maps are not real gene builds and unalignable parts cause differences that are not reconcilable.

PipelineUCSC.getCpGIslandsFromUCSC(dbhandle, outfile)¶

get CpG islands from UCSC and save as a bed file.

The name will be set to the UCSC name.

PipelineUCSC.readUCSCFile(infile)¶

read data within a UCSC formatted file. returns a list of key,value items

PipelineUCSC.writeUCSCFile(outfile, data)¶

write a hubfile to outfile from data.

PipelineUCSC.readTrackFile(infile)¶

read a track file.

Returns a list of tracks, each being a dictionary of keywords.

PipelineUCSC.writeTrackFile(outfile, tracks)¶

write list of tracks to track file outfile.

Returns a list of tracks, each being a dictionary of keywords.
